snippet: Human Rights Watch asserted in a report that the police in the Democratic Republic of Congo’s capital, Kinshasa, had killed at least 51 unarmed people, including five teenagers, during a three-month crackdown against organized crime.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch asserted in a report that the police in the Democratic Republic of Congo’s capital, Kinshasa, had killed at least 51 unarmed people, including five teenagers, during a three-month crackdown against organized crime.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
